Barreda, declared, he had not a braver nor more active soldier. One of the slaves, who had gone to a neighbouring ditch to draw water, spied an Abiponian horseman leaning upon his spear, and having his face painted with dark colours; upon which he called out Amigo, friend. This salutation being sternly rejected by the savage, the slave, greatly alarmed, told what he had seen to LisondO, who, always in- trepid, said he saw no immediate occasion for fear.
